content:
s.nakato said
There are two template folders. I wish to delete one, but I cannot delete it. Even when right-clicking, there is no delete option. Please advise me on how to delete the folder that won't disappear.

Try unsubscribing the unwanted folder. Right-click the account in the Folder Pane, Subscribe...
creator: sfhowes

content: 何度も右クリックをして削除を試みましたができませんでした。 削除という項目が出てこないのです。 どうやったら削除できますでしょうか。
creator: s.nakato

content:
s.nakato said
I tried right-clicking repeatedly to delete it, but it wouldn't work. The delete option simply doesn't appear. How can I delete it?

Did you right-click the folder or the account? You should see a window like the attached picture.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Se il server è su un percorso di rete, Probabilmente stai usando un path UNC https://learn.microsoft.com/it-it/dotnet/standard/io/file-path-formats che non sono più supportati da Thunderbird per ragioni di sicurezza

Se supportati da tuo dispositivo, prova ad usare percorsi assoluti o percorsi in formato IP
creator: @next

content: Would you please post a screenshot that shows the sent folders in the folder pane?
creator: mozilla98

content:
Is your Calendar settings configured to start at 8:00 AM  ?

I have the same version 140.2.0 ( on Windows 11 24H2 ) and it works fine for me.
creator: MichelT

content: Yes the Calendar settings are configured to start at 8:00 AM. I have just noticed that when I go to the email tab and go back to the Calendar : default view is set to midnight, and when I do the same thing again : the Calendar view goes back to "normal" (day time), I can ping pong between both views on and on. So up to now, I go back to my email twice to get the normal time view back on the Calendar, which quite annoying but the best I have found yet.
creator: thibault.cremel

content:
I see the problem now. Every times I switch from Calendar to email and then Calendar, it went back one hour : my calendar start at 08:00, switch to email and back to Calendar : it starts showing 07:00AM , back to email and then back to calendar : it starts showing 06:00AM and so on.

So you're right this is a bug.
creator: MichelT

content: I see what you experience, we both seem to have a bug related to the "Calendar time tracking" when we switch from Calendar to email : either going back one hour or displaying midnight/back to normal. By the way, yesterday, just before I had my actual "midnight display" bug, I experienced the "back one hour" bug you have right now.
creator: thibault.cremel

content:
Bonjour, Nous sommes chez vous via le serveur Ionos. Nous avons un gros problème avec une de nos adresses mail : julien@fabriqueparis.fr

Le problème ne vient apparement pas de Ionos, donc je pense qu'il vient de l'application Thunderbird. Je n'arrive pas à installer cette messagerie sur mon Mac, dernière génration. Je ne sais plus quoi faire. Pouvez vous m'aider svp ?
creator: julien22

content: You need to contact your email provider for the password. Thunderbird uses it to administer your mail, but cannot provide a new one
creator: davidsk

content: Thunderbird settings > General > Incoming Mails
creator: mozilla98

content: I forgot to mention, If I create a NEW task for a time when Thunderbird is not on, the Task does not pop-up.
creator: calvinou812

content:
I have a lots of problem with Task reminder since version 140 ( on Windows 11 24H2 ) . Sometimes it works, sometimes it does not. I re-created all my Tasks in a new calendar and the same problem persisted.

Workaround : I converted all my tasks to Events and I no longer use task.
creator: MichelT

content: I considered that. It seems to slow down the system, but I may do it anyway.
creator: calvinou812

content: Assuming that you are talking about an account password and not Thunderbird's primary password: you must re-set your password with your e-mail service provider.
creator: mozilla98

content: If you are using the new, experimental account hub, turn it off in settings and try again.
